IQuu7Gx2NDtoZW_G_DLxgA.text: Loved it! Got a table for four immediately, food arrived very quickly, was fresh and delicious. Not crazy about the eternally thumping soundtrack, but the pizza was worth it!

m9fY6l8UWHCcr5wKCJYx4g.text: Pizza is surprisingly cheap and delicious at the same time but there're very limited options for vegetarians.

nW8LEI-Phodf2YIkBlnefw.text: Good Italian pizza here, if a bit on the tough/dry side for my liking. Nice wines as well (organic, if I recall). This branch is a little crowded with tables very close together - which is fine, I just pity the adjacent couple who had to listen to our conversation.

5av7wdUEEuE4bOUnBvFm6w.text: Wonderful toppings and great pizza. I had the vegetarian special and it was divine! It had tomato, mozzarella, parmesan, sweet potatoes, and sun dried tomatoes. The pizza was delicious and the toppings were perfectly paired. Would definitely go again.

cWr-NlFAPYnIyaFgJ5b-og.text: Always great food and an even better atmosphere! The pizzas are exceptional value - it's worth the wait in line!

SZaa7j5_pLhnJX2XkGPMFw.text: What a shame.. Having been to their original site in Brixton many times and praising their authentic delicious pizza, we were disappointed with their offerings at their new Tottenham court road branch. Expanding their business has clearly ruined what I feel was an almost perfect combination of genuine Neapolitan pizzas with good ingredients in a grubby (in a good way!) corner of Brixton's market row. The Tottenham court road location is very formulaic, typical of your average Carluccio or Ask restaurant. The service was appalling. Not only were we seated at a table with the last customer's food on the table but the number of times we had to get the attention of the staff just to order our food and ask for the bill was ridiculous.With an open kitchen in the middle of seating area you would expect (or hope) that the staff would be aware of general food hygiene knowing full well that they are being observed by the seating customers. One waiter who was using a metal sponge to seemingly scrub off the burnt edges of each customer's pizza (why do that?!) accidentally dropped the sponge on the floor and promptly picked it up and placed back on the table ready to use again for the next pizza. Having eaten at Santa Maria's pizzeria in Ealing a few weeks before, the pizza of franco manca that I used to praise so much is no more. Ingredients are stingy and the base definitely different to how I remembered it in Brixton.

rrl6tJzJgpAelqD0gkVotg.text: Great food and love the organic beer. Not quite 5 stars as there menu is very limited and after a few visits you have tried everything. Pizzas are amazing though and good service!

2jNO16M6HcoQT9ZIVTI0Og.text: Fantastic pizza for the price. Try it with the chilli and garlic oils. Also, expect to queue any day during the dinner rush.

hE_yh-_j3cFp2O-CK6tDMw.text: One of the best Napoletana pizaria in London, highly recommended , the only thing that I disliked was " they don't do Calezoni " .

lKqDaQ52srptVU7YfBySXw.text: It is a chain but it is really really good. And it is keeping up with expectations. Does not matter if you go here, in Broadgate circle or in Golders Green. Their pizza, Neaple style, is really good and surprisingly cheap for London

78_-A9LQQeu-wcMo2y51eg.text: It's a new year and it was time to try a new place. Well, it's not exactly a new brand, they just opened up a new place at Fitzovia. Franco Manca is always a great choice for lunch and this new location does not make an exception. The pizzas are delightful and prepared in front of you in an open kitchen. The guys surely know how to handle their dough and can customize a pizza according to the client's preferences.

I7qcjx1bO0NFfxcRsEfHXA.text: great pizza and super affordable. best to take away to beat the queue!

1AIRoxFu9kDK0mPJCo1unQ.text: Franco Manca is the best!!! You must stop by in London! I always get #1 which is just sauce, garlic and basil because I have a dairy allergy. It is absolutely amazing!! The waiters are always so accommodating in ensuring the food is handled away from dairy products. The crust of the pizza is sourdough and is like nothing I have ever had before. It's filling without leaving you feeling heavy. I visited 3 times in 1 week once. It's that good.

7Nt1ZLL13vjLQM9JdQry3w.text: one of the best pizzas in london! no.4 (ham and wild mushrooms) is lovely.  the home made lemonade is tart and refreshing.  go there hungry and finish even the crusts which is very very tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. no.4 ham and wild mushrooms.  very tasty

HMs0a3e1xmYH3DfKcK-IWg.text: I loved my pizza which was on special and had potatoes on it - something that is not done so much in America.  I also liked the sourdough crust.  I also had the meat special pizza and it was good but nothing to write home about.  Would recommend as a good pizza joint if you're in the area and needing a pie.

2NabsDL-uklZBW_xAx3Yfg.text: Excellent thin crust wood-fired sourdough crust and it's surprisingly cheap, too. Each pizza is £5-8, which is surprising given how good the pizza is and the fact that it's a sit-down restaurant. They're open late which is great. Try to go at off-peak times because they're always busy

tfZxrSIPcm9SNDkLXUy_3g.text: 3.5 stars.First I have to preface this by saying I love Neapolitan pizza and have had it many times in pretty much everything restaurant worth trying. I have quite a high standard. Franco Manca's is good, but that's about it. Not great, not fantastic.It's a super popular place so Saturday around lunch time we were lucky to only wait about 10 minutes. Friday night they apparently had a one hour wait.The place is charming, open, and spacious. Nice rustic vibe. Huge pizza oven in the middle. All Italian workers, which is a great thing.We got the marinara (#1 - tomato sauce, garlic, oregano and I added basil for 50p) and the margherita (#2 - tomato sauce, mozzarella, basil but we subbed ricotta for mozzarella. The mozzarella isn't the best quality it seemed from looking around but the ricotta seemed rich and creamy. I appreciated no charge for swapping out the cheeses).The marinara was good, but lot very flavorful. When you get a pizza so plain, it's very important that the dough and tomato sauce are top notch. These were not. They were each ok. Nothing bad in particular, but not great flavored. Tomato sauce was weak and a bit acidic. The dough was bland dough. The texture would be benefited by undercooking it by a few seconds.The margherita with ricotta was better, but really because of the ricotta. The buffalo ricotta was great quality - rich and creamy with a delicate but powerful taste. Overall is recommend that one.I would be back because it's still good, the atmosphere is nice, friend service, very efficient (pizzas are made very fast even when crowded), and the portions are huge for the price. I'd recommend trying it, but don't expect amazing food. Definitely good overall though!

pAglZFkCCEAEFCK5gKA7EQ.text: Among my friends there is always a debate on who has the best pizza: pilgrims or Franco Manca. Sincerely, right now I still prefer Franco Manca, but over 4 people I am the only one with this preference with 3 votes for pilgrims. Considering I'm far better than my friends, that makes our final decision even, 3 votes each. One day we will find the winner!Anyway, this is just another good pizza place, with a plus for their appetizers. We have a small number of pizzas (as it should be), and a small selection of appetizers (usually just salami, cheese, ham). Appetizers are just what they say to be, good, excellent ham and cheese, that's it. No special things, nothing extreme, just a good mozzarella with a good evo oil.The pizza is on the neapolitan style, nice, high and soft. Now, sometimes it could be a bit undercooked, true, and they don't offer buffalo, which is just plain stupid and crazy, but it's usually a very good pizza, high and soft, with a very nice ring and with good ingredients on top.I just have some issues with the desserts, which seems supermarket style (or anyway something coming from big production, not homemade) and with the beers, I can't understand why they decided to subscribe a plan with a reseller where they can't serve anything else!Ah good aperitivo if you like, a nice spritz! take a spritz, a couple of appetizers and a pizza to share and you made your evening!This is surely in the top 3 of London pizza, not at number one (I'm looking at you, stand at the hawker house) but for a pizza place, that's really good, I mean seriously good.

4jfneld9y31-srx7nUy86Q.text: The best pizza I have had in a while. We had a 10 minute wait after work which wasn't bad and the service was great when we sat down. The best thing about this place is that they stick to the simple things and do them VERY well. Even better, everything is so cheap and extremely reasonable. I would 100% recommend this place to anyone and everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Amazing mozzarella! Add a dash of garlic oil and it's heaven!!

oXeXK1LIbOZU0rFhajAhPQ.text: First of all the map here is WRONG. So wrong. Damn you, Yelp, damn you to hell. It's on Tottenham Court Road, just go there, do not look at the directions on here. Pretty sure I had heard of Franco Manca before tonight and at the very least bookmarked one of its other locations, but when a friend suggested here tonight some faint alarm bells went off in my head*. Quite frankly, when you have a much-loved original venue and you branch out to more, the quality deteriorates and yet the crowds keep coming.**In future, I might well stick to one location only places. Because I'm pretentious like that. As soon as we sat down, the Pizza Express, sorry I mean Franco Manca waiter was right over, to hassle us into ordering. Charmingly monosyllabic he was. We ordered some garlic bread, burrata and pizzas each. The garlic bread was startlingly lacklustre, basically it was like a rectangular pizza base with some sauce and no sign of garlic. Pass. I love burrata. LOVE. So I was prepared to forgive it any sins, but when our virgin-burrata-eating-companion declared it bland, I had to agree. Sure, it can be a bland cheese, but with the right seasonings, it's a fucking symphony! This burrata was more elevator music. Onto the pizzas. So the sourdough base gives these pizzas a delightfully moreish personality, but when you get almost done, you do feel a bit like dying. It's almost the opposite of crisp neapolitan pizza. Mine came with various cheeses and meat, it was the Gloucester, I think. Very nice indeed, but I oddly wouldn't return. I did get pleasantly drunk on the £2.80 glasses of wine, so yeah, whoo! This place is cheap, that's why people go there, but when I saw the queue lining up outside, it felt sad, cheap is not the same as good. There are thousands of restaurants in this city and no need to queue for any of them. *On Tottenham Court Road, no less, can you think of anything good on TCR?**Ahem, looking at you, Burger and Lobster. And you, Meat Liquor!

MJKQdgGnkau0fJZDdsC1IA.text: Wow, this place is solid. Pizzas are really well done, tasty and cheesy. The dough is neither crispy nor bready and you can more or less personalise it with toppings. Cannot say it is 'the best' in London but it is top-notch.Service is very nice, the host even offered pizza bites to those waiting outside - a very nice touch indeed. Desserts are nothing special but good.It might seem cheap at first - £6 for a pizza! - but the moment you start adding toppings it spirals out of control. It is always packed so it might be worth exploring the other locations, the one is Chiswick is very comfy.

uiKRSTrp4Fe1rM37oyTU3w.text: Probably one of the best pizzas that I've had in the London. They're big for a good price and also pretty delicious. The mushroom and ham, and chorizo are great options, and all the pizzas are on sourdough. The lines for this restaurant are crazy so you better go early to snag a spot. Simple menu and great place to dine with friends!

FHMDOubN-MF-WuDkl9ACIg.text: Better pizza than almost everywhere else in london at half the price. Its very busy and the menu is small but authentic. You dont need to visit often but its always a great shout when you do!

mPR7Rz9ni46rWhg6aKDUdg.text: Underwhelming. An Italian would send this pizza back and ask for compensation. But this is London so you even get all the sourdough-related hype. Service is decent but slow. Really don't get all the good reviews guys. If you have never had a better pizza I feel really sorry for you.

XTRz71WzBMxz2eMPe8L0cA.text: Good food but poor service! I have visited Franco Manca at other branches before and I liked it, but I recently dropped in to this particular restaurant on Tottenham Court Road and was disappointed. I liked the pizza but the service was slow and the waiter was not the most efficient or friendliest of waiters.

TNRFM2B8A_5BetCd9eGfRg.text: Excellent pizzas at a great price, same as all of the Franco Manca restaurants. Only problem was the constant whistling of the chef. Not good if you suffer from misophonia.Also my girlfriend got a pervy look on the way out of the toilet.

jCQ9VQw8oTnJbwRNbjABKQ.text: This restaurant was fantastic.  I had the #6, a pizza with fresh mozzarella and chorizo. The sourdough crust was very tasty and our meal was reasonably priced. I enjoyed this pizza with a No Logo pale ale. It was the most hop forward ale I have had during my time in London and it really hit the spot. The service was great and the whole place smelled like pizza.

jdHROYvIRCF70tukdgW9fQ.text: I finally managed to come here on sunday night after having heard a lot about the sister restaurands. I need to say that the pizza is not only good, it is REALLY good. Very soft, well cooked, with good ingredients....as it is in the south of Italy where I come from.The place is very informal, the atmosphere is relaxed and the service is good. I had a pizza margherita and a "no logo" artigianal beer. My friend also had a margherita and still water and we ended up paying £7.75 each! I was shocked by discovering that there are pleaces soo cheap and so good in London.I will definitely come back!PS. they don't take reservations, so plan a bit of queueing if visiting on peek hours.

dd6pbunVKRbgqo_iBTynyA.text: so cheap for a London pizzeria - 6 quid ish for a pizza. not a massive selection but what they serve is clean and tasty. This is a chain though, but a good one if there is such a thing.2 people meal and drinks for £30 - cant go wrong

lbZpGkdgES-0N_KmHnA8cg.text: I often read Franco Manca reviewed as the best Pizza in London. That's hardly to be believed. Don't mistake me, it's a very good pizza compared to non-italian standards but it's far from perfection. Basic ingredients are average quality - in particular tomato sauce and mozzarella. I don't understand why they do not offer a buffalo mozzarella option (a must have for a pizza restaurant aiming to great quality) but the "Salsiccia e friarielli" (wild broccoli and sausages) is probably the closest thing to a real Naples pizza. What really I don't like is the dough texture - it's chewy and it leaves a background taste of ground flour - it could really be improved!That said, If you're around and want a pizza, is still better than most place you can find around (but not worth a 40 min line, less then exceptional on weekends)

dIV7qpzELzAj9cRsj02sUA.text: 3 stars for the food but 5 stars for the price. This place is really unbelievably cheap, especially for London and the dining atmosphere. Most of their ingredient are organic and fresh, all branded as no name or no logo. The pizzas are very thin and quite hard to cut through (using your hand to rip is actually much easier). Everything tasted as you would expect. But £6 for a large sized personal pizza? YES PLEASE. I wouldnt wait more than 30 minutes but if the restaurant is not very busy, Im all over it.

GDOwKo7BNlj5xQuPOHfGRg.text: This place is a good lunch spot. Handmade pizzas that emphasize fresh artisanal ingredients. The portions are generous and the value is good. Just watch out for any modifications or add-ons - they will charge you for each and every one, and it adds up!Nice open kitchen where you can see the pizzas being made. The service could use a bit of work, but then again they are pretty new at this location.I personally prefer Pizza East for both ambiance as well as more variety on the menu, but I would say this is a solid choice for a satisfying meal that won't break the bank.

_SCBnz5TbBsArYF8q_cRgw.text: Franco Manca on Tottenham Court Road must be a very recent addition to the slew of restaurants in the area, since I only just noticed it a few weeks ago. The interior is inviting and both times that I have gone, we have been seated pleasantly and promptly. They serve pizza. There isn't much more to say there--you get a big blackboard with their specials written on them on the wall, and there's also their selection on the menu--you may also have the option of creating your own pizza, but additional ingredients do get pricey; to get your money's worth you may as well order from the menu. Both servers I had were efficient and pleasant--shoutout to the Italian one with the very short dark brown hair--she sells the menu well without being overbearing on the customers. The dough on the pizza is amazing. I saw some diners leave their crust, but who am I to leave such deliciousness on my plate? It is thin and crispy and chewy, the ingredients are artisanal and fresh, and you can see your pizzas being made right there in the center of the dining area. For around 6-9 pounds for a pizza, the price can't be beat for Central London.I can definitely see this spot becoming a regular haunt for me--I can't wait to utilize the takeaway option in the future.

wOxvbXmKs6Qbz-YXyRrCSA.text: Excellent pizza, some of the best in London! I got the tomato, mozzarella, basil - a classic - and it was absolutely delicious.  Everything was really well-balanced and clean, and the cheese tasted fresh.  I would have preferred a bit more basil on top, though.  The real winner was definitely the sourdough crust, which was not overpowering, but definitely complimented the flavors of the toppings.  The unique base was perfectly cooked to chewy perfection.  Friendly service and casual atmosphere - it seems like people were genuinely enjoying themselves (pizza = happiness). I would highly recommend Franco Manca to anyone craving pizza in London!

5E3V8b4KfcODmD2EaW8LNw.text: I went here for dinner and I ended up getting takeout because I could not bear to wait in the long line spanning down the entire street. The first bite of my chorizo pizza left me singing to the heavens! But I have to say that after I finished the whole pie I felt like it was delicious but not worth the hour wait at all! I would recommend going for lunch or take out 100%, but don't bother with the line.

r7OZMhPMGLhN4NgVCQPxtw.text: Warning: this restaurant doesn't do reservations, and it was pretty busy even on a Tuesday night!I had the meat special (something with salami) and it was delicious! The side salad was a little small but pretty good, too-I thought the dressing was especially tasty. Don't come here expecting your regular cheese/pepperoni/combo pizzas-they use really fresh and interesting ingredients, which I liked! Overall good experience for a good price too. Split a pizza and salad between two people and you'll both be full for 5 pounds each.

li-aFJEKagelROQ5TvkPkw.text: I chose this place for a quick Monday night bite with a friend in town, having never tried Franco Manca before but well aware that it's considered one of the best pizzas in town. I arrived around 7 PM and there were about 5 parties in the queue ahead of me, but the staff quoted parties of 2 a wait time of 10 minutes, and a party of 4 a wait time of about 15 minutes. I thought that was impressive, because the restaurant isn't that big but the queue did indeed move fast! They don't seat tables until all members of the party are there and my friend was running late, so when he finally arrived, I was at the front of the queue and we were seated almost immediately.It didn't take long to order because the menu is fairly straightforward - you have a choice of 6 pizzas, with the option of a salad and some drinks. I got #4, which was with ham, mozzarella, ricotta and mushrooms. It has a note that says "little tomato" and the waitress checked if I was ok with it having little sauce, because I guess people complain about that normally. I was fine with it. We also got two bottles of lager, as they didn't have the pale ale in stock. I thought it was really good, tasting like honey and not at all like your typical lager.So our pizza arrived and it was your typical oversized pizza - I don't know how people ever justify that it is meant for one person. The problem is that the table is so small, that you wouldn't even have room to share food... At Pizza Pilgrims, we did so with no problem as it was a much larger space, but here you only have room for a plate in front of you! But soon after, one of our friends who studies nearby wanted to come join and say hi, and when she came, she just grabbed a chair from a neighboring party of 3 and we rearranged so that we could all fit at our table meant for 2.This really annoyed the staff, one of whom came over immediately and asked where we got the chair from, then said that it was not ok and that she couldn't sit there. It wasn't bothering anyone else, or a fire hazard, but he was really pissed off and didn't even offer us another table where she could join. And there wasn't anyone else in the queue, so it was not a ploy to try and clear tables faster. Basically then my friend had to wait at the door while we asked for our pizzas to be packed up and paid the bill. It was the most unfriendly service I have ever received and I didn't even get to enjoy my pizza!

eeawsiI_mPJY1NTJXiLoXg.text: OK! I've been saying for years that MCR is lacking a really good pizza place.. We need somewhere like this! Franco Manca's sourdough pizzas are quite possibly the best I've had. These freshly made pizzas are simple yet work amazingly well and cook in just a few minutes in their wood fired oven. The menu is small, yet everything you could want on pizzas - with the choice to add different toppings if you fancy it. I've sampled these types of pizzas through the likes of street vendors such as Honest Crust at Friday Food Fight - and was always impressed, but Manchester doesn't have a restaurant where you can go and sit in to eat such amazing pizzas. With 10 of these branches to choose from in London there's really no excuse not to pop into one! Franco's also makes and bottles their own organic lemonade - which was gorg! For someone who likes and eats A LOT of pizza - this place hits the spot. And there just so happens to be one in Balham right near my friends house. Perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Number 4!!
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Menu.

vsbWuk3j_HZ-IQelnjNr3w.text: Yum! Good value delicious pizza. Simple menu done well. Really good prices and lovely organic wine. Can't book though and gets really busy. Great pizza... if you don't like pizza it's not for you but if you do you'll love it. Great place to catch up with friends or family.  I love number 5 anchovie pizza! All on sough dough and are delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom

XVS37VxTN4gDltIM5S0nZw.text: Pizza was absolutely delightful - and the crust is fantastic. Don't throw away the ends! Sitting on the patio watching people walk by was a nice atmosphere. I would've given it five stars if we had received better service. Asked for the bill three times and each time the server didn't even acknowledge that we had asked before. He may not be working when you visit though - go!

ooFWKKxLyx653RRhKHplSQ.text: Visited this place on a Friday night. The place was busy but we only had to queue for a few minutes. Was keen to try this place because their sister venue in Brixton is quite famous. The service was good and friendly. I could try the wine before choosing a bottle which was much appreciated. The wine list is short and the wine is cheap but not really good. I'd rather pay more for a better wine. The 4 of us shared pizzas. They're good, dough is fresh and so are the rest of the ingredients. However these are not the best pizzas Ive had.Bottom line is I was a bit disappointed with my experience at this place but I guess I had set my expectations too high. Also it's good value for money.

ZrHepSCH0AogREi6K68V8A.text: I like it here.  Come with a small party (or alone; no judging, when it comes to pizza) and the line moves fairly quickly (no reservations).Part of why the line moves quickly: the pizzas come out quickly!  Beautiful sourdough pizzas with slightly charred bottoms (THAT SOUNDS SAUCY) and puffy light crusts.  There's a meat and veggie special of the day, but I'm a fan of the dry-cured chorizo, broccoli and mozzarella atop my pie.  That's not exclusively true: I LIKE IT ALL.  Other options: salads with creamy burrata, greens, fresh organic lemonade and the plumpest of green olives.It's not a quiet, private dinner spot, but it is fast, and affordable and solid quality.  In and out: 10GBP.  B00m, indeed.Yelp note: chili oil on the table and constantly refilled carafes of water!

CDjxBMdXgEnrgSmPrge8Aw.text: This is a pretty awesome place to grab a quick pizza for lunch. We came here around noon on a Friday, and it filled up quite quickly (but I've walked by it on other days of the week and it seemed less busy at similar times, so it's probably quite popular on a Friday). There isn't a massive selection: the pizza menu is quite small. They do allow you to add toppings if you so choose though, which does allow for a bit of customization.The price is pretty reasonable as well. You're looking at less than a tenner for a pizza, and if you don't go for any drinks or sides, you've got yourself a pretty cheap and filing lunch. I ordered the meat special (some proscutto with cheese and radicchio), and I was pleasantly surprised. The crust is slightly crisp, but mostly chewy with a hint of sourdough (so if you're not a fan of sourdough, this place wouldn't be for you).The service is super attentive as well. We got asked twice if our pizza was good (but I think it's because they were on the hunt for a pepper grinder to take to another table and the first time I didn't let them, because I actually wanted to put some on my pizza). They also did the really confusing non-British thing of removing my plate before everyone was finished. They're also really good at being ninja-water-bottle replacers as we were never without a bottle with sufficient water in it.They also provide some olive oil on the side. But not regular oil, there's a bottle of garlic oil and a bottle of chili oil. I found it very delicious to dip the pizza crust into when I was down to that end. The chili oil was especially nice (and what I was looking for because the chili I ordered on top of my pizza was a tad lacking in spice). So four stars for the food, but an extra star for the delicious oils and fantastic service. To be fair, they were probably trying to get us out quickly as there was a massive queue when we left, but I didn't really mind that much.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Wine and beer! (And part of the kitchen).
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Bacon!!
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Anchovy, caper and olive

86LlwlaxhN2hHfEq-bIwRw.text: We read it was the best pizza place in London. It probably is!!Service is great, too. The place is busy, I guess that's what you get when you have the best of something. The staff is all-Italian, and man they're loud, but that only makes it more authentic.At last a pizzeria which we will return to. Franco Manca has achieved what most have failed in London: an amazing pizza at a competitive price.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Organic lemonade
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Organic lemonade
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Meat special

TZ2Ru6xdcGzeizEyqI9OLg.text: If you're looking for authentic Napoli-style pizza, with thousands of tiny bubbles through the wood-fire baked dough, then look no further in London. This is really one of the top. You only need to listen to the number of Italians working the oven and eating in the venue to realise that it really is where Italians choose to have their pizza in London.The toppings are fresh and not overdone. Quality mozzarella and tomato passata. The sourdough base is a really strong feature and the most enjoyable part of the pizza. You leave feeling light and happy, not bogged down by carbs.Although not on the menu, the desserts are lovely! Chocolate cake was simple and a nice addition after a Margherita pizza. The homemade fizzy limonata is also a must try.A quick, casual and very fun dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Margherita

z9FVrdVkHaI10-6lSfRCmQ.text: Always incredible. Great food, lovely ambiance, good drinks, reasonable prices. I love Franco Manca and come here regularly! Worth the wait.

9LOtuSvOedl6BjmKYEdZyA.text: Sourdough crust pizza is very unique and equally delicious. I highly recommend trying this pizza to anyone craving a new twist on an old favorite.

1cuLtgxBYs2AD1YaORWn0w.text: We waited about half an hour at around 8:30pm and honestly it was 100% worth it!! Such chewy and tasty dough and eating one entire pizza is not painfully filling. The sauce is probably my favourite part, it's so tangy and really brings the whole pizza together. People were STILL waiting in line even at around 9:30pm when we finished, which is just proof of how good it is!!

MO9PqcxzrTgqJu7WcSDAKw.text: Simple, casual but very good quality pizza at a super reasonable price. Menu is simple with 8-9 styles of pizza only but each ingredients is high quality. Pizza dough is soft and tasty with lovely crust whilst fluffy on edges filled with sourdough flavour. Stretched to the right thickness in the middle - it is a very good base for a great pizza.Ingredients are seasonal and simple but all great quality for all around 6-7 gbp.Interiors are nice and hip - casual but relaxing. Seats are not too small - very good value

wdb9VDLN1o_9zp237-C1vw.text: Bomb pizza! The pizza is so good that you don't really need to add meat to your pizza to have a fantastic experience. Solid ambience and the wait isn't long.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Chorizo, mozzarella, basil pizza

P3p4bIYhGY5Yfa3b9ZJbUA.text: Been here a few times over the last few months. The pizza is fantastically soft and light, and the overall experience is great. I tend to go here for fun dinners with my fiancee -- I wouldn't recommend going for a business lunch simply for the potential noise level.Pros:- Great pizza- Fast service- Very efficient (it's the little things, water is served and replaced at your table with no action on your behalf, for example)- Extremely reasonable pricesCons:- If you go at a busy hour, it could well be very, very loud in the restaurant- If you go at a busy hour, you may be standing outside for a little bit in the queue (although this is understandable -- it means they almost always seem to be able to be at max capacity)

ykvqZl7Nn7K52o9MHp6e-Q.text: Amazing.  Hands down.  Went with with a huge group of 10 fellow tourists, so we waited probably 45 minutes, maybe an hour at most, in line outside and ended up having to sit as 8 and 2.  But I didn't mind at all, since it had such great reviews and may only be in London once. HIGHLY RECOMMEND the Chorizo pizza.  Sooo good - on the menu it seemed plain to me at first, but you can add whatever other toppings you want.  Closest thing to pepperoni on the menu.  Also, the burratta appetizer was so delicious.  Like ridiculously delicious.  I want it now.In the end I was super full but enjoyed every...last...bite.  Now, can I find a place like you here in LA, Franco Manca?  That is the question.  #mmmm

ZAcsFP5JhjzM9JfK7KiQyw.text: We came here with another couple. One half is Neapolitan, the other is... married to a Neapolitan! They consider this the best pizza outside of Italy.My confession is that I don't love Neapolitan-style pizza. DON'T TELL THEM. But I have actually been converted a little by Franca Manca (and Pizza Pilgrims), and given the really top ingredients, I might even come back for the pizza occasionally.I couldn't finish a whole pizza with the crusts, so I left about half my crusts, which were eagerly snatched up by our eating companions. Apparently the chili oil I doused on my plate was spicy for them, whereas I couldn't taste it much. So, different taste buds, yet positive experiences all around!

m0VKdEtCdtB37dhaXkhKIA.text: Good pizza, with a real forno a legna. The ingredients seemed to be quality. The staff was all Italian and very friendly. We also had an organic lemonade which was delicious.

rIkEvZjHokX2GZvExxb42Q.text: What is there not to like about this place? The pizza is great (that crust!) and the drinks selection is spot on with some really lovely organic wines. I had a birthday dinner here with a few friends and we all enjoyed ourselves. It does get busy though, so you may have a bit of a wait.

_0_nbznLitLbTTPyvSDzkw.text: Bellissimo!Went there with friends yesterday as my B'day dinner, and it didn't disappoint. What a dinner to start the night with!We weren't really excepting a long queue on a Monday night. We reached the place around 8:30 and there were still three groups waiting ahead of us. We waited about 15 minutes and finally got in. We tried No. 2(margherita), 4(with hams and mushrooms), 6(with chorizo and tomato) and Meat Special(with lamb sausages). We had our own and tried a slice of each other's. Unanimously, our rankings is: 6# -- Meat Special -- 2# -- 4#. I loved my chorizo one, and the flavor is great. The only thing I can complain is that I wished there were more cheeeeese. The meat special one comes next. The lamb sausage on top tasted absolutely lovely, but again, we wished there were more of them...The margherita was cheesy enough, but we all felt 4# was a bit too light and weak in flavor. It might have tasted better if there was a bit of tomato? The dramatic bit is that a waitress sent what should have been our orders(two 4#) to a table next to us, and we arrived much earlier than them. She didn't realize the mistake until another waiter found out. The gentleman who was in charge of our table was really nice. When we asked for our bill, he offered us five limoncello as the digestvo in compensation for our waiting. What a beautiful mistake! We never mentioned anything about the birthday, but it seemed we still had our birthday special! :D I've been trying to learn some Italian for months, so I also experimented some italian conversations with him, and he was absolutely sweet to ignore all the lameness. Overall, we were all very happy with the food and the service. And I think I forgot to mention that the price is very reasonable and the quantity is more than enough!Buona serata!

FVui1gGxHQn7aYCrAhNvnA.text: Cheap, delicious pizza! Taste like you are in Italy and it comes with waitresses yelling in Italian. You get the entire package.Just be careful of the line. May take longer than you think but food arrived fairly quickly! Also wine is served in water cups and they have a heavy hand. Will be going back soon!

zHLUpQnDekKMjvtSd8GALA.text: At £5-8 per pie, Franco Manca serves affordable and quality sourdough pizza. The ingredients they use are super fresh and locally sourced. My one qualm is that they don't put enough toppings, but they always oblige whenever I ask them to prepare my pizza with extra tomato sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Tomato, mozzarella & basil (6.40)

Ndec39aIMom19SO_Hdx1gA.text: Food: 4/5Service: 3/5Cleanliness: 3/5Decor & Style: 3/5Pretty good pizza just not my favorite. Very fresh ingredients and basil which I love. It just didn't give me an "OMG" factor.

zxCQLSv-vS1gQRtgX-2Rpw.text: Fantastic pizza for an exceptional value. We had two pizza and a salad for under 17 pounds. Extremely fresh ingredients, fast delivery of food. Service was not attentive at all. Had to wait a LONG time to pay when we were done eating. Food is great - service not so; however, we will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom

SnLFjrXojgmoyXqlc6LxVw.text: Disliked their policy regarding disabled patrons. Staff training was poor both with waiters and management

O2BnFfq1K5n1ns3g3VQqVg.text: Excellent food. A pizza place delivering as a healthy food option.  Everything was fresh and tasty. We had a couple of salads and a # 4 pizza. The pesto dip for the delicious sourdough crust was fantastic. Very reasonable prices. Attentive service. Highly recommend!

QaQ3frDToI2zY-sRBCjstQ.text: My friend from London brought me here for my last meal, and I was happy to finally experience a place that locals frequent. The pizza is okay-priced ranging from £5-8. That would be more that enough to buy an entire pizza to share in the states, but is considered inexpensive here. Comfortable environment that is upbeat and busy, and my friend told me that there's typically a line out the door and impossible to get a seat inside. Luckily we were able to find a table inside on a Saturday night. Food:+mozzarella cheese ball with flatbread appetizer: this was the best food all night. The mozzarella is a large ball that has a delicious smoky taste that goes great with the arugula on the side. They only provide 4 tiny pieces of flatbread though. +chorizo pizza: I was happy that the pepperoni pieces were large and had some bite to them and not stingily cut and thin. The pizza shape is irregular because they hand toss the pizza and the crust is thick and airy. There's already a lot of oil, but it also tastes great with adding more spicy oil on the top. I only finished half. Great experience in a local joint. The pizza is average but comparably better than most of the foods I've had in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Pizza
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Mozzarella appetizer
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Chorizo pizza

aLLAnkIz2BWzjUeJSN7KlQ.text: I'm not one for chains but this one knows what it's doing. Thin sourdough pizza with fresh cheeses, anchovies, meat and veggie options. This location offers outdoor seating and quick turn around on the pizza. There are daily specials spelled out on the chalk wall inside, so check them out - it's worth it. So, this place is a pizza chain. Skip on the wine selection, focus on the pizza.

uBRv5dLcQKaiICPM7aDe7A.text: Franco Manca is wild. The pizza is a blessing. The drinks are constantly flowing. The crowd is always kept happy with cheap and delicious cals. I would highly recommend! Maybe the one pitfall is the wait, but that's how you know it's probably somewhere worth waiting for.

m9OjLISPqjwHK_Pq9Sxi8A.text: We're shown to our table and it's hard to hear each other speak, probably because it's just so darn busy in this restraint and it's most likely filled with people saying how great the pizza is.The atmosphere is heavy with rich smells and chatter, the lighting is bright, it's airy and warm, most people sharing tables.Considering it's a Friday I think we're pretty lucky to get a table so quickly, I've walked past so many times and the queue has been out the door.However the staff seem to take this in their stride, a well oiled Pizza machine and withing 10 minutes our pizza is ordered and on the table.We order one each and share 3: wild broccoli, mozzarella, Gloucester old spot hand sliced sausage and 4: Gloucester old spot ham (home cured ), mozzarella, buffalo ricotta, wild mushroomsBoth are absolutely delicious, and where the hand crafted base has puffed and topping devoid, we drizzle tasty olive oil and chilli oil on our plates to dip.I particularly love the 4: the base is creamy and wild mushrooms have a wonderful earthy taste.We're both particularly impressed with the fact so many of the ingredients are locally sourced.At less than £7 a pizza, we're left thinking not only we've had a bargain, but also full and happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom

V-2WFeIx7bDmcun7g6JnKQ.text: It's made right after you order so right out of the stove for you! It's quite big in size too so worth the money! The tomato sauce here is amazing too!

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom

dLyb0Sw5pBsqEemZdGchZw.text: Fresh, delicious homemade pizzas with terrific service and atmosphere.  The outdoor seating is really terrific, but you will be harangued by street beggars and scam artists every few minutes, but you are given a pizza cutter at your table.  Once you stab the first one or two, things quiet down because other beggars need to step over bodies to approach you.

qmcLu7_gEttWSmiEyepPDA.text: AMAZING PIZZA. Perfectly cooked sourdough crusts that left me missing Italy. Also-- super affordable...like almost "too good be true" affordable. tip: be sure to check out the chalkboards on the wall-- there are menu items and specials up there that are NOT on the main table menus. Our waitress didn't tell us about that (or any specials). Be warned-- it is usually packed so service is a little hectic. Our waitress seemed really frazzled and didn't speak English well enough. She also didn't write anything down. She was really sweet, but it was tough to get her to understand our order (and remember it).  Will definitely go again (and again)

7pms2FsVcSs9vs30np3P7Q.text: Delicious pizza, excellent location. What's not to love? Good spot for quick lunch, be prepared for food coma afterwards though - you can't NOT finish the pizza! We ordered two different ones and had half each. Service was quick and we were allocated seats on a Friday lunch very quickly!

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Gloucester old spot ham, mushroom pizza

rPtBsWeH-j8BRP_dxm1yCw.text: Hiya fellow italian food critics, so we was searching the area for quality food with a low price . The sight of £6.50 margarita pizza caught our eyes, we was excited to have a full pizza for such a low price. we were happy. As we lined up, all was well, we came to a conclusion that we wanted garlic bread, OH NO THAT WAS A HELL OF A WRONG DESCION !!, the garlic bread was around £5 which was a shocker seeing as it was only a starter. as soon as we saw the starter our jaws dropped with dissapointment. it was charcoal black with many green herbs. didnt look like garlic bread to me!!! although, we remained hopefull. we took a seat in the seating area ready for the grub. we took a bite of the garlic bread, wow, shocking. tasted acidic. the herbs overpowered everything, even the charcoal base. there was no such taste of gralic. more like acid. the portion was massive which was a plus, but wouildnt ever eat more than a bite of it. the pizza however was decent, however there was four of us amd none of them were perfect. either anemic or burnt crisp. the drinks were a whopping price of £2.99 for a glass bottle of cola. overall i wouldnt recoment. good bye guys im saving you some decent money.

zV7Lnaqiuj-KPtsldSTX8w.text: Having grown up in Manhattan, gone to school in Chicago and currently living in the booming culinary scene of Washington DC, I know good pizza, and this is it.  Had the meat special.  Chewy thin crust, fresh rocket, thinly sliced cured meat.  Great.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom

Rz9amo10ecGhH28HkAvRlA.text: Excellent Pizza with a cool unique twist. Sourdough crust is delish and highly recommend ordering the side of fresh pesto to dip the crust in (Delish!). For those of you that like pepperoni, highly recommend the spicy chorizo topping - SOO good!!

ppBgFOPESCUVLA6r8b46bw.text: Started off so well, me and my friend came for lunch it looked pretty busy and we thought we might have to wait for a table but it's much bigger on the inside than it looks.  We were quickly shown to a table and someone came over to take the order after a minute or 2.The pizza took a little longer than expected to arrive but looked tasty and was covered in plenty of topping. It atmosphere is a little noisy with all the chattering and maybe this is where some of the confusion came into play on ordering I was asked if I would like tomato, I did think this was a strange question to ask and said yes. My friend ending up scraping the extra tomato off as she doesn't like it and then when the bill arrived I noticed an extra charge, I wasn't going to grumble over 95p but I thought I'd just mention it to the waitress. On doing so she grabbed the receipt and said she'd take it off, she came back and quickly and impatiently processed our order and then sarcastically thanked us and stormed off. We were pretty surprised to say the least.

QLvKf38P4Ayl3PwZJ7FGiw.text: Good and light traditionally cooked sourbread pizza. Very tasty but the menus is limited.  Our meal was upset however by one of the rudest waitresses I've ever come across. It left a bad taste. She was very aggressive and angry as we asked if something was an extra charge. I've never been treated like that in a restaurant before!

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Special meat pizza

ET9BnVvYLl1c3MxnBSE7ow.text: What: One of London's best sourdough pizzas. That's what they're know for and that's what they do well. Don't bother with dessert, it's not really their forte.Tip: Yes, you'll want some garlic pesto with that. And probably a bit of olive oil too to dip the crust in.How much: The bill usually comes to around £20 for two people. No, I don't know how they do it either.When it comes to date, most people think expensive, Michelin-type restaurants, where you have to dress up to get in.  I usually think small, rather busy restaurants that would let me sit there for the entire evening, sipping wine (or cocktails, I'm rather flexible you know!) and eating all sorts of delicious things straight from the plate. But that might very well be because I'm not really good at booking tables, or planning dates in advance for that matter...One of my favourite places to visit for un-planned dates (and general meals out) is Franco Manca. I go pretty much every single time we're near Warren Street. I went when my friends visited from France. Hell, I even went for brunch on Valentine's day! And also some time last week...The burrata (from the specials board, but it features onthere quite often!) was creamy and light, and the accompagning toasted sourdough toasts and salad were great too. From the small pizza menu, my absolute favourite is the n°6 as the chorizo is excellent.cakeandwhisky.wordpress.…

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Burrata, Franco Manca
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Pizza n6, with extra olives, green peppers & garlic pesto, Franco Manca
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Franco Manca
